Italian.title: Spaghetti Carbonara
ingredients: 1 tbsp kosher salt for pasta water
Italian.instructions: Cook spaghetti in salted water until al dente, reserving 1/4 cup pasta water. In a large pan, cook pancetta until crispy. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. In a bowl, whisk eggs, cheeses, and black pepper. Drain pasta and add to pan with pancetta. Remove from heat and quickly stir in egg mixture and pasta water. The heat from the pasta will cook the eggs into a creamy sauce. Serve immediately with extra cheese.

Italian.title: Margherita Pizza
ingredients: 8 oz fresh mozzarella di bufala, torn
Italian.instructions: Mix flour, yeast, and salt. Add warm water and olive oil, knead for 10 minutes. Let rise for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 500°F with pizza stone. Roll out dough and place on stone. Spread tomato sauce, add mozzarella slices, and drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 12-15 minutes until crust is golden. Remove from oven and add fresh basil leaves. Slice and serve hot.

Italian.title: Risotto ai Funghi
ingredients: 8 oz mixed wild mushrooms (porcini, shiitake, cremini), sliced
2 tbsp dried porcini mushrooms, soaked and chopped
Italian.instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pan and sauté onion and garlic until translucent. Add mushrooms and cook until they release moisture. Add Arborio rice and stir for 2 minutes. Pour in white wine and stir until absorbed. Gradually add hot chicken stock, one ladle at a time, stirring constantly. Continue for 18-20 minutes until rice is creamy and al dente. Remove from heat and stir in butter and Parmesan. Garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

Italian.title: Osso Buco
ingredients: 1 can (14 oz) San Marzano diced tomatoes
Gremolata: 2 tbsp lemon zest, 3 cloves garlic minced, 1/4 cup parsley
Italian.instructions: Dredge veal shanks in flour and brown in olive oil. Remove and set aside. Sauté onion, carrots, celery, and garlic until softened. Add white wine and deglaze pan. Return veal to pan and add beef stock, tomatoes, thyme, and bay leaf. Cover and simmer for 2 hours until meat is tender. Serve with gremolata (lemon zest, garlic, and parsley) and risotto alla Milanese.

Italian.title: Tiramisu
Italian.instructions: Beat egg yolks and sugar until pale and thick. Fold in mascarpone cheese. Whip heavy cream to stiff peaks and fold into mascarpone mixture. Mix espresso and coffee liqueur. Dip ladyfingers in coffee mixture and layer in a dish. Spread half the mascarpone mixture over cookies. Repeat layers. Dust with cocoa powder and refrigerate for 4 hours. Garnish with dark chocolate shavings before serving.

Italian.title: Bruschetta
Italian.instructions: Toast baguette slices until golden and crispy. In a bowl, combine tomatoes, basil, garlic, olive oil, and balsamic vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Let mixture sit for 10 minutes to allow flavors to meld. Top each toast slice with tomato mixture and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately as an appetizer.

Italian.title: Chicken Marsala
Italian.instructions: Pound chicken breasts to even thickness and season with salt and pepper. Dredge in flour and brown in olive oil. Remove and set aside. Sauté mushrooms and garlic until golden. Add Marsala wine and deglaze pan. Add chicken stock and return chicken to pan. Simmer for 10 minutes until sauce thickens. Stir in butter and parsley. Serve with pasta or mashed potatoes.

Italian.title: Minestrone Soup
Italian.instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot and sauté onion, carrots, celery, and garlic until softened. Add tomatoes and vegetable stock. Bring to a boil and add beans and pasta. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add zucchini and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in spinach and basil. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with grated Parmesan cheese.

Italian.title: Gnocchi alla Sorrentina
Italian.instructions: Boil potatoes until tender, then mash while hot. Mix with flour, egg, and salt to form a dough. Roll into ropes and cut into 1-inch pieces. Press with a fork to create ridges. Boil gnocchi until they float to the surface. Drain and toss with olive oil. Layer with tomato sauce, mozzarella, and Parmesan in a baking dish. Bake at 400°F for 15 minutes until bubbly. Garnish with fresh basil.

Italian.title: Panna Cotta
Italian.instructions: Sprinkle gelatin over cold water and let stand for 5 minutes. Heat cream, sugar, and vanilla bean until steaming. Remove vanilla bean and stir in gelatin until dissolved. Pour into ramekins and refrigerate for 4 hours. To serve, run a knife around edges and invert onto plates. Top with fresh berries, berry sauce, and fresh mint.

Greek.title: Moussaka
Greek.instructions: Salt eggplant slices and let drain for 30 minutes. Rinse and pat dry, then fry in olive oil until golden. Brown ground lamb with onion and garlic. Add red wine, tomato paste, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Simmer for 20 minutes. For béchamel sauce, melt butter, add flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually add milk, whisking until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in egg yolks. Layer half the eggplant in a baking dish, top with meat mixture, then remaining eggplant. Pour béchamel over the top and sprinkle with cheese and breadcrumbs. Bake at 375°F for 45 minutes until golden and bubbly.

Greek.title: Souvlaki
Greek.instructions: Marinate pork cubes with olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, thyme, rosemary, salt, and pepper for 4 hours. Thread onto skewers and grill over medium-high heat for 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked through and slightly charred. Serve hot with warm pita bread, tzatziki sauce, and sliced tomatoes and onions.

Greek.title: Spanakopita
Greek.instructions: Sauté onion and green onions in olive oil until softened. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Drain excess liquid and let cool. Mix with feta cheese, dill, parsley, eggs, salt, and pepper. Layer 6 sheets of phyllo dough in a baking dish, brushing each with olive oil. Spread spinach mixture over phyllo. Top with 6 more sheets of phyllo, brushing each with oil. Score top layer and bake at 350°F for 45 minutes until golden and crispy.

Greek.title: Pastitsio
Greek.instructions: Brown ground beef with onion and garlic. Add tomatoes, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Simmer for 20 minutes. Cook pasta until al dente and drain. For béchamel sauce, melt butter, add flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually add milk, whisking until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in egg yolks. Layer half the pasta in a baking dish, top with meat mixture, then remaining pasta. Pour béchamel over the top and sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes until golden and bubbly.

Greek.title: Greek Salad
Greek.instructions: Combine tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, olives, and feta cheese in a large bowl. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper. Pour dressing over salad and toss gently to combine. Let sit for 10 minutes to allow flavors to meld. Serve chilled as a refreshing side dish or light meal.

Greek.title: Dolmades
Greek.instructions: Rinse grape leaves and pat dry. Cook rice until partially done. Sauté onion in olive oil until softened. Mix rice with onion, dill, parsley, pine nuts, currants, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Place a grape leaf on a flat surface, vein side up. Put 1 tablespoon of rice mixture in the center. Fold sides over filling and roll tightly. Repeat with remaining leaves and filling. Arrange dolmades in a pot, seam side down. Add water to cover and simmer for 30 minutes. Serve hot or chilled with lemon wedges.

Greek.title: Baklava
Greek.instructions: Mix walnuts with sugar, cinnamon, and cloves. Layer 10 sheets of phyllo dough in a baking dish, brushing each with melted butter. Spread half the walnut mixture over phyllo. Layer 5 more sheets of phyllo, brushing each with butter. Spread remaining walnut mixture. Top with 10 more sheets of phyllo, brushing each with butter. Score top layer into diamond shapes. Bake at 350°F for 50 minutes until golden. Meanwhile, make syrup by combining honey, water, sugar, cinnamon stick, and lemon juice. Simmer for 10 minutes. Pour hot syrup over hot baklava and let cool completely before serving.

Greek.title: Avgolemono Soup
Greek.instructions: Bring chicken stock to a boil and add orzo pasta. Cook for 8 minutes until pasta is tender. In a bowl, whisk eggs and lemon juice until frothy. Gradually add 1 cup of hot stock to egg mixture, whisking constantly. Return egg mixture to pot and stir gently over low heat for 2 minutes until soup thickens slightly. Do not boil. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with fresh dill and serve hot.

Greek.title: Saganaki
Greek.instructions: Dredge cheese slices in flour. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add cheese slices and cook for 2-3 minutes until golden and slightly melted. Carefully pour brandy over cheese and ignite with a long match. Let flames die down naturally. Squeeze lemon juice over cheese and sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately with crusty bread for dipping.

Greek.title: Galaktoboureko
Greek.instructions: Bring milk and sugar to a boil. Gradually whisk in semolina and cook for 5 minutes until thickened. Remove from heat and whisk in eggs and vanilla. Layer 10 sheets of phyllo dough in a baking dish, brushing each with melted butter. Spread semolina mixture over phyllo. Top with 10 more sheets of phyllo, brushing each with butter. Score top layer and bake at 350°F for 45 minutes until golden. Make syrup by combining sugar, water, cinnamon stick, and lemon juice. Simmer for 10 minutes. Pour hot syrup over hot galaktoboureko and let cool completely before serving.
